Transcript: Livvie: Where's Jamal?
Alison: He had to cover at the Recovery Room.
Livvie: So, what, do you want to just hitch a ride with me and Jack?
Alison: I wish.
Livvie: Alison, what's up?

Alison: You know how you convinced yourself that Jack was this, you know, 
really great guy and you could really trust him and --
Livvie: Could you just get to the point, please?

Alison: Yeah. I met this detective who Chris Ramsey hired and then fired, and 
he was going to throw away his evidence --
Livvie: Alison --
[tape recorder turns on]

Jack's Voice: You want the truth, Chris? I used Livvie. Is that what you want 
to hear? I used her to get even with you. That's the truth. That's why I came to 
Port Charles.
[Knock on door]
Kevin: You can't come in unless you know how to tie a Windsor knot. Lucy.
Lucy: I know I said I'd stay away, but I couldn't. Especially not today.
Eve: Hi. Well, say something.
Victor: I -- I'm without words.
Eve: Never. Not you.

Victor: You are so beautiful. You are as beautiful as the day when you and 
Monk first exchanged vows. No, you are more beautiful -- by virtue of our nearly 
having lost you.
Eve: Still the poet, Victor.

Victor: No, no, no. Only when I'm inspired, my darling girl. Mmm, you smell

Eve: Where's Mary?

Victor: She's inside greeting the early arrivals. I was going to lend her a 
hand, unless you'd rather I stay.

Eve: No, no, no, it's ok. You go ahead. I was just outside getting a breath 
of fresh air. I have the jitters, I think. Isn't that silly?
Victor: No.
Eve: I mean, this isn't even a real wedding.
Victor: The vows are very real as long as you really mean them.
Jack: Uh, what's going on here?

Alison: Oh, besides you being the biggest jerk on the face of the earth, not 
a whole lot.
Livvie: Alison, Alison, I will handle this.
Alison: Call me if you need me.
Livvie: Yeah, I promise.

Alison: You better be nice because if you're not, I will make your life 
miserable. And trust me, I can do it.
Jack: What's her problem?
Livvie: Well, why don't you hear for yourself.
[Tape recorder turns on]

Jack's Voice: I used Livvie. Is that what you want to hear? I used her to get 
even with you. That's the truth. That's why I came to Port Charles.
Livvie: Jack, I was kind of hoping for an explanation.
Jack: I don't have one.
Livvie: And why not?
Jack: Because it's all true.
Arianna: You can't make me leave the country with you. Ian will stop you.

Ben: Why don't you ask this Ian if your friendship is worth dying for, and 
then we'll see.

Gabriela: What's going on in here? There's supposed to be a security guard 
outside this door.

Ben: That's no longer necessary. I'm Arianna's brother. I'll be taking care

Gabriela: This patient is not cleared for visitors, so I can call security or

Ben: I'll go. But I will be moving forward with the plans I mentioned. Good

Gabriela: Are you ok? I can get another guard down here.
Arianna: It won't help. He brought Immigration in on this.

Gabriela: Do you want me to get somebody down here for you to talk to? A 
psychiatrist, maybe?
Arianna: There's no one that could help me now.
Kevin: Lucy, you shouldn't be here.

Lucy: You don't think I don't know that? The problem is, see, is I can't stop 
thinking about you, Doc, and I can't stop thinking about us.
Kevin: Did you even try?

Lucy: Yes, of course I tried. Look at me. I bought a whole new wardrobe. I 
bought a new car. I even went on a date with a man I hardly knew, and I even 
bought a whole house.
Kevin: Well, congratulations.

Lucy: All that brand-new stuff -- it doesn't work. I still see you everywhere 
-- in my new car, on my date. I even saw you in my house. Do you know what you 
did?
Kevin: I can only imagine.
Lucy: You -- you carried me across the threshold.
Kevin: Except that I didn't, Lucy.

Lucy: But you did in my heart and in your heart. Doc, every fiber of my being

Kevin: Lucy, please, don't do this to yourself.

Lucy: You're not going to go through with this ceremony because you know it, 
too. You know we belong together.
Kevin: No, I belong with Eve.

Lucy: I went to the police station the other day and I saw Mac, and he told

that. You had those charges dropped, and you wouldn't do that for somebody 
unless you really and truly loved them.
Kevin: Lucy, why do you insist on making this impossible for both of us?

Lucy: Because I know what you want, Doc. You want me here because you want 
me, deep down, to stop all this insanity. You deny it. You deny that you want me 
as much as I want you.
Kevin: I want you to go.
Lucy: You don't really mean that.

Kevin: Damn it, Lucy! Eve and I are going to be together, and there is 
nothing that you can say or do that's going to change that. Now, I wish you 
would get that through your head and just leave me alone.
Eve: Glad you could make it.
Ian: You look breathtaking.
Eve: People always say that about brides.
Ian: I've never said it.
Eve: How's your girlfriend?
Ian: My girlfriend?
Eve: Yeah, the one in the hospital.

Eve: But I thought that --
Ian: You thought what?
Eve: I saw you together. In your apartment. She was in your arms.
Ian: You saw us?
Eve: Yeah. I guess I just have lousy timing.

Eve: Thanks, Mary.
Mary: Your handsome husband is waiting.
Ian: You'd better go.

Eve: No, no, Mary. I guess if my husband's waiting --
Mary: Oh, my goodness.

Eve: I can't.

Ian: That's what friends are for. And not just for tonight. For always.
Livvie: So they were right. You were using me.

Livvie: But wait a minute. You claimed you didn't even know who your brother

Jack: Yeah. Yeah, it was.

Livvie: So -- so you came to town to take something away from him the way he

Jack: Yeah, that's all true, but so is this. You got to me. You changed my

Livvie: You lied to me about everything. You made a fool of me!
Jack: But that's not what I wanted to do. Trust --
Livvie: Go to hell, ok?

Jack: You got to see that Chris is behind all this, and he's trying to do

Livvie: Chris hired a private investigator who dumped the evidence. 
Fortunately, Alison found it.

Jack: Oh, you think that was an accident? I'd bet my life that Chris is

Livvie: This is not about Chris. This is about you admitting that you were

Jack: Livvie, please, you got to hear me out.

Lucy: Um -- oh, what the heck, sure. You know what? Pour and then just leave

Jack: Yeah, bar-- beer? Do you have beer with a back?

Minister: We are gathered here today to celebrate the reuniting of Kevin and 
Eve. These two people, so deeply in love -- having nearly lost each other, they 
were faced with the fragility of their lives and love. With that in mind, 
they've asked you all here to witness their deep commitment to one another as 
they restate their vows for eternity.

Minister: So to want to reaffirm those vows here tonight is a reflection of 
the devotion these two people feel.
Ian's Voice: Not just for tonight. For always.

Minister: Eve? Eve, are you and Kevin ready to entrust your hearts and souls

Kevin: Uh, ye-- yes.
Eve: Yes, of course.

Minister: In our long history, we have never discovered a better way of life 
than sharing it together in love in a lasting and responsible way.

Minister: With this ring, Kevin, do you reaffirm that which you've already

Kevin: I do.

Ian's Voice: And not just for tonight. For always.

Minister: That you once again declare your love and devotion to Kevin -- that

Ian: This is what I wanted -- to have you with me, to hold you, to make love

Eve: Why do we have to stop?
Ian: Because I love you. And one moment in time couldn't nearly be enough.
Eve: Make love to me.
Oh.

Ian: I don't just want you for one night. I want you for always. I want us to 
grow old together and still love each other. And we will, I know it. I saw it

Eve: How can you be so sure?
Ian: After everything we've been through, how can you not be?

Minister: May this man and this woman be a blessing and comfort to each 
other. May they trust each other, trust life, and be unafraid. May they love 
each other and offer love and support to those around them not just for one -- 
for always.
